slideInfo.title: What is the historical context of the data?

pButton.popInfo: 1938 is the year before World War II began and almost 10 years into the Great Depression.
By 1953, 8 years after World War II ended, most European countries had recovered economically to some extent. The Cold War had begun, and the Soviet dictator Joseph Stalin died.

1963 was the height of the Cold War. The USSR spent heavily on defense and the space race and economically exploited its satellite states such as Poland and East Germany. In Western Europe, full recovery from World War II and an expansion of consumer goods was in full swing.

1980 was the dawn of the information age. New technologies were being developed. Europe was emerging from a severe recession in the 1970s. The Cold War was on going, with continued build- up of nuclear weapons in the USSR.
